title: Lori Loughlin's daughters Olivia Jade and Isabella Giannulli are no longer enrolled at USC as she faces up to 40 years in prison
text:
Lori Loughlin's daughters Olivia Jade and Isabella Giannulli are no longer enrolled at the University of Southern California, amid the college admissions scandal.

Court documents allege that Loughlin and her husband paid $500,000 to guarantee admission to USC for her daughters by posing them as recruits for the crew team.

The "Fuller House" star is among more than 50 parents who were charged with bribing universities to allow admission for their children. Fellow actress Felicity Huffman is currently serving a 14-day prison sentence for her role in the scandal, after she paid $15,000 to falsify her daughter's SAT scores.

Though Huffman was sentenced to 14 days in federal prison, Loughlin could face a much harder penalty. She and her husband could be sentenced up to 40 years in prison if they are charged on both counts, as the pair pleaded not guilty to charges while Huffman accepted a plea deal.
